featured_reviews.name: Jean-Fran√ßois BOHRINGER
featured_reviews.review_text:
Nous nous sommes rendus pour la premi√®re fois chez Ander Nautic puis Arcachon Nautic, deux √©tablissements du m√™me Groupe, apr√®s avoir lu tous les avis des clients, parmi lesquels tous ceux qui sont clairement argument√©s sont extr√™mement positifs.
Nous avons trouv√© ce que nous recherchions ; accueil irr√©prochable, humilit√©, qualit√© d'√©coute et de conseil de Nikita (chez Ander Nautic) puis de Yoann (vers lequel elle nous a orient√©), totale transparence inspirant confiance, comp√©tence technique, respect des engagements (notamment en mati√®re de d√©lai de livraison) etc...
A l'approche de la livraison de notre CAP Camarat 7.5 WA S√©rie 3,  fin avril 2023, nous avons √©t√© mis en contact avec Susana, assistante commerciale et SAV, Olivier, le chef d'atelier et Jordan, l'un de ses techniciens ainsi qu'Isabelle , leur assistante, puis Samuel, responsable du magasin USHIP.
Nous appr√©cions beaucoup le travail d'√©quipe pr√©cis et suivi efficacement - m√™me en p√©riode de surcharge d'activit√© - r√©alis√© par l'ensemble de ces personnes toutes aussi professionnelles que sympathiques; l'achat et la livraison du bateau ne constituent pas une finalit√© mais le d√©but d'un partenariat au long terme; c'est ce que nous avait "vendu" Yoann et nous sommes ravis de lui avoir fait confiance.
Sensibles √† la notion de "r√©serves" que le client est susceptible d'√©mettre sur un produit qui est fabriqu√© dans les ateliers Jeanneau, Yamaha et ceux des √©quipementiers, loin d'Arcachon, nous appr√©cions grandement la mani√®re avec laquelle cette √©quipe locale s'efforce de lever ces r√©serves dans les meilleures conditions et d√©lais possibles sans se d√©fausser de la responsabilit√© qui incombe aux concepteurs/constructeurs.
C'est notre premier achat de bateau, nous ne pouvons comparer notre r√©cente exp√©rience qu'√† celles que quiconque peut vivre en faisant l'acquisition d'une voiture ou d'un appartement et le fait d'avoir choisi Arcachon Nautic pour r√©aliser notre projet de navigation d√©cuple le plaisir qui en d√©coule.

Jean-Fran√ßois BOHRINGER
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Bonjour Monsieur BOHRINGER, nous tenons √† vous remercier tr√®s chaleureusement pour cet avis positif. Nous vous souhaitons le meilleur dans votre projet de navigation !
featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
We went for the first time to Ander Nautic then Arcachon Nautic, two establishments of the same Group, after reading all the customer reviews, among which all those which are clearly argued are extremely positive.
We found what we were looking for; impeccable welcome, humility, quality of listening and advice from Nikita (at Ander Nautic) then from Yoann (to whom she directed us), total transparency inspiring confidence, technical competence, respect for commitments (particularly in terms of delivery times) etc...
As the delivery of our CAP Camarat 7.5 WA Series 3 approaches, at the end of April 2023, we were put in contact with Susana, sales and after-sales assistant, Olivier, the workshop manager and Jordan, one of his technicians as well as Isabelle, their assistant, then Samuel, manager of the USHIP store.
We greatly appreciate the precise and efficiently monitored teamwork - even in periods of busy activity - carried out by all of these people, all as professional as they are friendly; the purchase and delivery of the boat does not constitute a finality but the beginning of a long-term partnership; This is what Yoann ‚Äúsold‚Äù to us and we are delighted to have trusted him.
Sensitive to the notion of "reservations" that the customer is likely to express on a product which is manufactured in the Jeanneau, Yamaha workshops and those of the equipment manufacturers, far from Arcachon, we greatly appreciate the way in which this local team strives to lift these reservations in the best possible conditions and deadlines without relinquishing the responsibility which falls to the designers/builders.
This is our first purchase of a boat, we can only compare our recent experience to those that anyone can experience when purchasing a car or an apartment and the fact of having chosen Arcachon Nautic to carry out our navigation project increases the pleasure that results from it tenfold.

Jean-Fran√ßois BOHRINGER
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_translated_text: Hello Mr. BOHRINGER, we would like to thank you very warmly for this positive review. We wish you the best in your sailing project!

featured_reviews.review_text: What a cool and relaxed place to be , the whole port area has restaurants galore all with a great people watch facility to them . Massive car park at the port but has a height restriction so high vans will not get in , there are plenty of fashion shops around the same area . Definitely worth a visit .

featured_reviews.review_text: Very beautiful port. Beautiful path to walk around. During the Christmas season, the boasts are lit up with lights form evening time. Great atmosphere.

featured_reviews.name: Andy Jefferson
featured_reviews.review_text: A delightful fishing town with beautiful fishing boats, cafes and a wonderful fresh produce market that has a wonderful array of locally grown fruit and vegetables, olives, garlic, local cheeses and freshly caught daily seafood. featured_reviews.name: Stelian Nitu
featured_reviews.review_text:
One of the most visited ports ( more like parcs) we are going with the kids. The are plenty of attractions, restaurants and rides for the kids, carousel, slides, etc.
Many activities organized most of the time especially in the summer time. If it happens to be around after 15 August you have, most likely, the opportunity to enjoy one of the traditional, yearly, fireworks.
A big parking and  a good place to visit when in  town.
Old wood boats offer a very memorable experience. Have fun.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text: 2 hours by bus to see the same thing as from the outside. 4 year old child possible when booking and when we arrive, a very unpleasant person tells us "She's 4 years old? She's going to find it long, you should have done the Escal Atlantique visit instead! Plus you won't be able to enter workshop number 2" OK so what do I do, I abandon her on the platform? Couldn't you say that before booking?" I try to go to the counter to ask if we can switch to the other, more suitable tour, of course they tell me no. So here we are, off for 2 hours of long long long bus rides... 30 bucks for that. PS I never knew what workshop number 2 was, there was only a 10 minute stop in a sheet metal and welders workshop. Really no point. Photos prohibited but nothing in any case to photograph. Like the impression of having been fooled like many others...
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_translated_text:
Hello Lauriane, 
We thank you for sharing your experience of visiting the Chantiers de l‚ÄôAtlantique. We sincerely regret that this visit did not meet your expectations and understand your frustration, in particular regarding the reception and adaptation for your 4 year old child. Please accept our apologies for the lack of information and the unpleasant tone you encountered. 

Visiting the Chantiers de l'Atlantique is a unique opportunity to discover one of the jewels of French and global industry. Aware of the security issues inherent to an active industrial site, we implement strict protocols to guarantee the safety of everyone. The visit takes place by bus, between the workshops, to allow you to observe the activity of the Sites as closely as possible while respecting these safety requirements.

We understand your disappointment at not being able to visit workshop number 2. Access to certain workshops may be restricted for security reasons or depending on the progress of construction. However, the current visit offers an exceptional overview of major projects. Currently, our visitors have the chance to observe the Orient Express Corinthian in the assembly hold and the start of construction of the MSC World Asia, impressive achievements which demonstrate the unique know-how of Chantiers de l'Atlantique.

We are sorry that the stop at the sheet metal and welders workshop did not seem interesting to you. However, it is an essential step in understanding the scale and complexity of shipbuilding. Concerning the ban on photos, it is linked to industrial confidentiality requirements.

We sincerely regret your feeling of being cheated. We hope that these details will shed light on the organization of this very special industrial visit. We invite you, during your next stay, to discover Escal'Atlantic, an immersive museum which could better meet the expectations of a visit with a young child.
Kind regards, Chlo√© - Communication Department

featured_reviews.name: Joyce Rambert
featured_reviews.review_text: In 1984 the Chantiers de L'Atlantiques searched throughout France for one building architect to learn to design cruise ships. The previous year, my ex-husband was an unemployed French architect because he left his American job to pursue a speculative venture in Lyon. It did not work out and our marriage of nine years unravelled. I took our daughter and began a doctorate at the University of Wisconsin, having left my doctorate at the University of Chicago and my career dreams to follow my husband. He told me if the last project he began worked out, he would not return to America. I thought the marriage was over. But our daughter was a Daddy's girl. She was so unhappy without her father. When I called him, he had moved back in with his parents and said he would " wash dishes to stay in the South of France." I suggested he ask for his job at John Portman's in Atlanta again. When he did not. I called them for him. Mickey Steinberg the big boss suggested my mother get him a visa to get back in the country. I also contacted a congressman. When he returned Steinberg sent him to Singapore separating him from our daughter and me. He had not told Steinberg about his failed venture in Lyon. He drew incredible designs and had two years to leisurely work in architectural design, but he and his partner made designs that sabotaged their success. But because I am Brown and my husband did not tell the truth Americans and Asians sabotaged our marriage with the complicity of my husband. The Chantiers chose my husband because of his American Master's and work experience according to Jacques Brutinaud former personnel director of the Chantiers. Nevertheless despite my years of sacrifice and support of my husband there was no longer a place for our daughter and me in his life. We moved to France and I stood by him as he learned the job and I fell in love with Saint Nazaire. I even wrote a children's book set there. But after five years my husband left the Chantiers and followed him to Paris only to discover that he was removing me from my beloved saint Nazaire so he could install his Chinese liver there. I took the children to my mother's house in the US, and after my husband found his current wife in a Paris dating service when I was pregnant with our fourth child I considered divorce. A year after the birth of our child I divorced Jean-Philippe. When I tried to take our four franco-American children back to our home at 24 rue Vivant Lacour the Gendarmes ignored my co ownership of the house and used an expired contract I signed to rent the house until Jean-Philippe and his new wife could move in. The shipyard was good to my husband and our family in that it provided a good income and made us respected in the community. But when Jean-Philippe used his job as a cover and went on a cruise with his married Chinese lover missing the birth of our second child, the shipyard was mute. After he missed the birth of our fourth child and exiled his own children from France by blocking our houses he was put in charge of ship building. There is a problem with morality in France as seen by the current story of the husband allowing his wife to be raped by 50 men. But the Chantiers provided money that helped me raise my children and buy back my inherited land and put a cottage on it. Je regrette que je me peux pas ecrire des longue discourses en Francais. L'sbglais estbplus faciles por moi.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
It took me a while before deciding to write this message because I'm not used to sharing my impressions on social networks. Now, it seems right to me to point out serious failings.
Having purchased a 2016 MF 755 from this merchant at the end of 2022, I accepted the opinion of my "sales advisor" who told me that the recent nature of the unit did not require an appraisal. The word came from a dealer of the brand, I left with confidence.

Big mistake!

After a visit and a little negotiation, my boat was delivered to the south of France. and there, disaster...
- the fairing was completely botched. The antifouling was applied without preparation and came off the hull after 3 months!!!! (testimony from the professional who repaired this)
- The stainless steel propeller seemed to be affected and was warped / large vibration in the steering wheel (change necessary)
- waterproofing of the saloon windows and that of the cabin faulty (to be completely redone)
- Non-functional marine toilet.

Of course, used boats are purchased "as is" but we expect a different quality of service from a dealer of a major brand and its representative.
By neglecting its customers in the network, the brand will lose its soul... the words of a business manager!

Therefore I absolutely do not recommend this service provider.

featured_reviews.name: Jo Garrigan
featured_reviews.review_text: Worth the walk for this historical spectacle. It's about half an hour for the able bodied, with nice views back across L'Orb and to the Cathedral. For the less mobile, the little train takes you from the Cathedral to the locks and return with interesting facts about the locality en route. Toilets and cafe at the top of the locks, plus option to take a canal boat trip. Best booked in advance in busy periods.

featured_reviews.name: Terri Hanson Mead
featured_reviews.review_text: We were in a boat going up stream and had to wait 45-60 minutes for a tourist boat to go through before space opened up for us.  This is standard. It took about 45 minutes to go through all of the locks once we got started. This was one of the coolest things I have ever done and highly recommend doing it. We wish we could have gone down stream and then back up again but we had limited time until we had to return our boat. It did require 3 of us‚Ä¶2 in the boat and one on shore.

featured_reviews.name: Regis Denefle
featured_reviews.review_text: A rather exceptional engineering feat built in the 17th century to create a navigable route from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean. In addition to being a spectacular series of locks in short succession, the canal has a tunnel, several cool bridges including one for the canal to cross above the river. I recommend obtaining details about the history to appreciate it best. Boat tours are long if you take the roundtrip, might be best to join a tour only do the way back down, going towards the Mediterranean.

featured_reviews.name: Jay Kimmal
featured_reviews.review_text: Historic and beautiful place watching the boats rise and fall between the Atlantic and Mediterranean.

featured_reviews.name: J Buckland
featured_reviews.review_text:
We had booked a canal boat ride.  At the ticket reception we were asked if we would like to book a picnic and a short, perfectly adequate menu was available.
The day was, for us, far to hot but umberellas to use as parasols were provided for anyone who wanted to sit in the open on the upper deck whilst the lower deck had fans blowing out misted water which was very welcome.
The ride was leisurely and very enjoyable.  At one point a boat came alongside to pass over the freshly made sandwiches for our picnic.  Cold drinks were available as well inside the boat.
At one stage there was an issue with one of the lock gates but aerosols of 'water mist' were passed around by the very pleasant crew member, to ensure we didn't overheat.
A very enjoyable trip to do and everyone we dealt with was very welcoming.

featured_reviews.name: ANA 22
featured_reviews.review_text:
GO,GO,GO!!!
I was there and it was almost 100 dry degrees f'.
But it was worth it!
This incredible work of engineering will impress even the experts. And it is cool too.  There is a cafe at the top of the locks with nice food and drinks. The staff was incredibly friendly and did not make fun of my terrible bits and peices of French. Spend a day or two here and head up to the Church. Views are stunning with plenty to eat and drink up there as well.

featured_reviews.name: SteveplusChris
featured_reviews.review_text: Well worth the visit. You can only use the official car park that is 7 euros or catch the mini train from Beziers centre but that's 13 euros. Take time to walk the slope beside the locks that are all unique with some very pretty areas along the way. Very efficient system now all electrically operated. We were lucky to see 6 boats down the system in just an hour.

featured_reviews.name: Where Ami
featured_reviews.review_text:
Boats, barges, water, ducks, locks.
A very pleasant location for a stroll whilst watching canal life. This would be a great spot for a picnic.
Be wary of getting stuck on the wrong side of the canal as if you head upriver then it's quite a while before the next crossing point.  A short walk will bring you to the aqueduct where a canal bridge takes you, and the canal, over L'Orb River. Impressive engineering!
